result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:13 AM Cases called: 22CF150, 22CF169, 22CF190, 22CF212, & 22CF295. Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kyle Lee Mitchell in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Kyle Lee Mitchell. Agreement recited by ADA Ross. In 22CF190 Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1,2, & 3. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Counts 4 & 5 dismissed and read in. 22CF150, 22CF169, 22CF212, & 22CF295 dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 36 months. Conditions of probation include: Submit DNA sample. Successfully complete Columbia County Drug Treatment Court. 30 days jail, imposed and stayed for treatment court use. Restitution of $2430.91. Costs on count 1 of $518.00, count 2 $268.00, & count 3 $268.00. If defendant successfully completes the treatment court, court will consider early discharge from probation. 91 days jail credit.  9:33 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Atty Allison Borsheim - request for global

1:35 PM Cases called: 22CF150, 22CF169, 22CF190, and 22CF212. Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle Lee Mitchell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Claire Edwards appeared by video for Kyle Lee Mitchell. Reason for the missed appearance given. Court gave defendant 60 days to pay the forfeited signature bonds of $1,000.00 total in the Br. 3 cases. Bond recommendations. Court set $2000.00 cash bond in each case. All prior conditions remain. None of the cases have had preliminary hearings. Warrants are quashed. 1:45 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
failed to appear 6/2/22 Br. 3 for plea/sentencing hearing

3:11 PM Cases called: 22CF150, 22CF169, 22CF190, and 22CF212. Prosecuting attorney Brenda Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle Lee Mitchell not in court.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Kyle Lee Mitchell. This was set for a plea/sentencing hearing. Attorney Borsheim did not have any information as to why the defendant is not present. State requested a warrant. Attorney Borsheim requested 10 business days for a stay of warrant. Court denied the request. Warrant is authorized in all cases. The signature bonds are forfeited on the Branch 3 cases 22CF150 and 22CF212. 3:15 PM
Plea/Sentencing Hearing 6-2-22 at 3:00 pm

11:33 AM  Cases called: 22CF150, 22CF169, 22CF190, and 22CF212. Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle Lee Mitchell in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Kyle Lee Mitchell. The victim in 22CF169 would like to be present for todays hearing, but was not able to attend today due to short notice. Court will reschedule these hearings. Court and Counsel discussed how to proceed. Court amended the bond in 22CF212 to a $500.00 signature bond. All prior conditions remain. Victim was able to call the DA's office to let them know when she is available for the plea/sentencing hearing.  11:48 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
